config.question: Which of the following best explains why the Republicans accepted the Crittenden proposal guaranteeing that slavery would be immune from federal interference?

choices.content: They were anxious to ward off any potential armed conflict between themselves and the seceded states.
The Republicans had always claimed that the Constitution precluded them from meddling with slavery in the South.
They planned to use the concession as a bargaining chip for readmission of the southern states into the Union.
The Republicans were keen to restrict the practice of slavery to the South and prevent it from spreading to the North.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Republicans had always questioned the government’s authority to involve itself with slavery in the South. See L.O. 15.1 What developments and events drew the Union toward Civil War?
